title: Understanding Hypomania
text: Hypomania is a less severe form of mania. It is important to understand how it differs in terms of impact on daily life.

title: Impact on Functioning
text: Consider how hypomania affects a person's ability to function socially and occupationally compared to mania.

title: Progression to Psychosis
text: Think about whether hypomania can lead to psychosis, unlike mania.

hintAnswer: milder form that typically does not impair social or occupational functioning to the extent that mania does and does not progress to psychosis
title: Key Differences
text: Identify the key differences between hypomania and mania in terms of severity and progression.
choices: milder form that typically does not impair social or occupational functioning to the extent that mania does and does not progress to psychosis
more extreme form that typically does not impair social or occupational functioning to the extent that mania does and does not progress to psychosis
more extreme form that typically impairs social or occupational functioning to the extent that mania does and does not progress to psychosis
